data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'callback' of undefined
data.body:
I guess this is my own code causing this, but can't seem to figure it out.

[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. install package ensime-atom (java and sbt and an sbt project and the whole shebang unfortunately)
2. start an ensime
3. stop it
4. start it again
5. stop it - now it blows up:

The code here:

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/command-registry.coffee#L251

compiles to:

```
for (_j = 0, _len1 = listeners.length; _j < _len1; _j++) {
          listener = listeners[_j];
          if (immediatePropagationStopped) {
            break;
          }
          listener.callback.call(currentTarget, dispatchedEvent);
        }
```

and for some reason `listener = listeners[_j];`turns out to be undefined. Don't ask me why if this is single-threaded :)

**Atom Version**: 1.4.0-beta3
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.2
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'callback' of undefined

```
At /Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/command-registry.js:260

TypeError: Cannot read property 'callback' of undefined
    at CommandRegistry.module.exports.CommandRegistry.handleCommandEvent (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/command-registry.js:260:19)
    at __bind (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/command-registry.js:3:61)
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.dispatchCommandEvent (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:536:16)
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.handleKeyboardEvent (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:359:22)
    at WindowEventHandler.module.exports.WindowEventHandler.handleDocumentKeydown (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-event-handler.js:97:36)
    at HTMLDocument.__bind (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-event-handler.js:3:61)
```
### Commands

```
     -2:58.5.0 core:confirm (div#select-file.select-list.fuzzy-finder)
     -2:28.8.0 command-palette:toggle (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused.hyperclick)
     -2:25.5.0 core:move-down (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -2:25.2.0 core:confirm (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -2:25.2.0 ensime:start (atom-text-editor.editor.hyperclick)
     -2:24 core:confirm (div#select-file.select-list.fuzzy-finder)
     -2:19.3.0 command-palette:toggle (atom-workspace.workspace.scrollbars-visible-when-scrolling.theme-base16-tomorrow-dark-theme.theme-atom-dark-ui)
     -2:17.2.0 core:confirm (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -2:17.2.0 ensime:stop (atom-workspace.workspace.scrollbars-visible-when-scrolling.theme-base16-tomorrow-dark-theme.theme-atom-dark-ui)
     -2:15.2.0 core:confirm (div#select-file.select-list.fuzzy-finder)
     -1:01.6.0 editor:consolidate-selections (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -1:01.6.0 core:cancel (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -1:00.3.0 command-palette:toggle (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused.hyperclick)
     -0:58.5.0 core:confirm (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -0:58.5.0 ensime:stop (atom-text-editor.editor.hyperclick)
     -0:57.9.0 core:confirm (div#select-file.select-list.fuzzy-finder)
```

data.title: After opening several, tabs are not all displayed.
data.body:
After opening several tabs (about 18), the tabs are not all displayed. Atom 1.5.0-beta0
![bugtab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/296379/12351290/cfdf7f84-bb7c-11e5-85b9-5194fcc053b4.png)

data.title: The 'find and replace' result screen should have more features
data.body:
After search when the result are shown, there should either be a checkbox for each result so you can pick which result you want to replace, or the user should be able to quickly replace each result so he doesn't have to go to each single result and manually replace the text. Either a right-click command on the result itself, or a little button next to the gutter for each result which replaces and lets you regret it.

It's really annoying when you have to replace something which occurs 99 times, but you want to replace only 75 of them.


Help please?

data.title: package specific setting page become not accessible from v1.4.0
data.body: After upgraded to v1.4.0, setting can not accessible for page which have `activationCommands`, I first noticed in my package, but confirmed this issue is also happen for symbols-view package. I'm not sure this issue is for settings-view or Atom core. But I believe all package which have `activationCommands` in `package.json` have affect this issue. OS X 10.9.5 Atom v1.4.0 When I reverted to v1.3.3 the issue not happen, OR when I removed activationCommands section from package.json issue not happen(can access setting page via settings-view) The setting page I'm saying is package specific setting page by clicking setting button of specific package panel. Screen capture with `symbols-view` package. When I removed `activationCommands` from `package.json`, setting page become accessible.

data.title: Build error on windows：OutOfMemoryException
data.body:
Hello
trying to build atom,  OutOfMemoryException occured during grunt task _create-windows-installer_, 
here are some logs from _SquirrelSetup.log_, which located in _build/node_modules/grunt-electron-installer/vendor/SquirrelSetup.log_

> 2016-01-15 09:37:08> DeltaPackageBuilder: We couldn't create a delta for app.asar, attempting to create bsdiff
> 2016-01-15 09:37:09> DeltaPackageBuilder: We really couldn't create a delta for app.asar: System.OutOfMemoryException
>    in Squirrel.Bsdiff.BinaryPatchUtility.Create(Byte[] oldData, Byte[] newData, Stream output)
>    in Squirrel.DeltaPackageBuilder.createDeltaForSingleFile(FileInfo targetFile, DirectoryInfo workingDirectory, Dictionary`2 baseFileListing)

It seems that generating delta data for app.asar cost lots memory. 
_grunt-electron-installer_ called _Update.exe_, in windows task manager, I noticed that  _Update.exe_ 's memory usage up to 1G.  My computer has 8G RAM and at least 1G avaiable at that time, but OutOfMemoryException still occurs. Don't know why, pls help me out.
###### building environment
- system: windows 7 SP1 64bit
- RAM: 8G
- python: v2.7.10
- nodejs: v4.2.4

data.title: This fixes ability to override default git provider
data.body:
Let's say, we have default git provider and packages for hg and git.
First of all, setPaths is being called earlier then consumer, that
means that default git provider will already be there.
Second, we are checking for @repositories.length when adding new
provider, but if default git provider is already there, we're in
trouble, because another git provider simply won't be initialized.
Third, if we'll leave that condition there and fix something else,
again, after consuming hg, we'll have setPaths called with default
git adapter :( This kinda complicates stuff on first load / plugin
enable-disable on fly, but I don't feel that this is a big issue.

data.title: repositoryProvider - new logic suggestion
data.body:
Hi!

I'm currently working on custom git provider which will work exactly like mercurial's one for Nuclide.

The problem is that using current logic implemented in Atom, if we have .git repository, we might have it resolved to default GitRepository implemented in Atom because if we are adding provider for GitRepository, there will be two with conflicting names and current resolve mechanism is barely predictable because currently Atom is trying to Promise.resolve all providers at once.

What I suggest is to have replacement logic instead - if we have custom git-repo implementation in packages, let it override the default one (it's implementing the same interfaces anyway) or let's change Promise.all logic to step-by-step one - it will be slower to resolve repo provider for project, but we will ensure that we tried to use custom provider before GitRepository one. I'm ready to provide pull request for review for any solution you will choose of these two.

Otherwise, it will make implementing custom git repository impossible or we'll have to :ship: our own version of Atom if we need one.

data.title: ctrl-alt-shift-a doesn't register as a hotkey
data.body:
when i upgraded to 1.3.0 i somehow lost my custom ctrl-alt-shift-a hotkey. my keybinding resolver shows ctrl-alt-shift-<something_else> works, but when ctrl-alt-shift is pressed it does not detect A for some reason.

Ubuntu 14.04, Atom 1.3-1.4

data.title: CPU pegged at 100% in due to .git directory in home directory
data.body:
Atom has always been a performance disaster on my MacBook. I give it a try with each major release and watch Atom use 100% CPU and keep eating over 2GB of RAM.

After a long exchange on [Hacker News](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=10901691) about the current version 1.4 release, I dug deeper and ended up finding a [solution buried](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3426#issuecomment-119780457) in several other issues posted here. 

I had long ago accidentally created a .git directory in my home directory. This caused Atom to process my entire 350GB home directory. Deleting ~/.git and restarting Atom solved the problem. 

I am sure what the underlining technical issue is here. Why should Atom process the entire home directory. 
- If this is a _bug_, it should be fixed. 
- If this is a _feature_, a warning should be provided to users that their home directory contains a .git folder, which will hinder performance. Perhaps with the ability to disable the feature. 
- This issue should be more easily found in documentation, FAQ, trouble shoting. It actually took me two hours today to track this down, and this is after nearly two years of not using Atom because it was a  resource hog. 

I am sure many people have accidentally (or intensionally) created a ~/.git directory at some.

data.title: Feature request: base64 previews
data.body: Would be nice to have previews for base64 blobs. Example here (Brackets): https://igotfryd.wordpress.com/2016/01/13/little-things-that-matter/

data.title: "Reveal in tree view" shows the wrong file when in split panes
data.body:
The "Reveal in tree view" tab context menu option reveals the currently focused file, even if invoked from the context menu of the active tab in another pane, which may be a different file.

(v1.4.0 on Ubuntu)

data.title: Atom crashes when git and hg are present in one project
data.body:
Atom crashes when trying to "Add Project Folder" of a project that has both hg and git.
I use hg-git to mirror two repositories (hg and git).

I wasn't been able to generate the log using `atom --safe`

data.title: 'CMD + W' will close an Atom window if no tabs are open
data.body:
As the title says, hitting CMD + 'W' will close the entire window if there are no open tabs to close, despite the hotkey being set to Shift + CMD + 'W' for 'Close Window'.

Only happens as of 1.4.0, running OS X 10.11.2

data.title: Further improvements to pending item functionality
data.body:
Further improvements to #10178

Improve terminate pending state tests.
Serialize pending state for editor.
Keep pending item upon losing focus.

data.title: Add a keep-indentation on newline option rather than auto-indent
data.body:
<strike>In some cases I've found the Editor Settings->Auto Indent to misbehave. Don't get me wrong, in many cases it works great. However,</strike> I think it would be great to have the option to indent newlines to exactly match the indentation of the above line, but then not do anything further.

<strike>In the worst case, I've had the auto indent increase indentation for every new line, which I've then had to remove (I think when working with mixed languages in the same file).</strike> It is more often the case I want the indentation the same on a newline and am happy to change it myself at the start and end of blocks.

data.title: indentation being changed on paste despite auto indent on paste unchecked
data.body:
I have both Editor Settings->Auto Indent and Editor Settings->Auto Indent On Paste unchecked and start with a new plain text file (using hard tabs):

```
one
    two
```

where `two` is indented with a tab. I place the cursor at the end of `two`, hold shift, press up and copy the selection. This _should_ copy a newline character, a tab character and the word `two`, i.e. `"\n\ttwo"`. Then I paste, and get this:

```
one
    two
        two
```

somehow an extra tab has been injected. Additional pasting increases the indentation even further! I expected this:

```
one
    two
    two
```

Interestingly, if `one` is also indented before copying, the correct behaviour is observed. It's as though atom is counting the difference in indentation between the lines selected when the text is copied. Personally I hate anything that tries to be too fancy and automatic, and it is _far_ more frustrating to me than the times when something could have predicted what I wanted and didn't.

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/Users/tuneonmymind/.atom/keymap.cson'
